questions.question: Find the profit percent earned after selling an article at a doubled rate for half quantity.
The shopkeeper sells an article for 600 rupees. If the profit is 20% of the cost price, find the profit.
A shopkeeper purchases an article for 500 rupees. If the profit is 37.5% of the selling price, find the profit.
An article is sold at 20% less than its cost price. If the selling cost is 50 rupees and the selling cost is 5% of the selling price, find the loss.
If the seller sells half of his goods at 20% loss and the rest of his goods at 50% profit, find the profit percentage on the entire transaction.

The price of an article is increased by 20% for the shopkeeper, he further increases the selling price by 50%. The initial profit percent was 25%. If his initial profit was 50 rupees, find the profit now.

The initial price of an article is decreased by 20% but the selling price remains constant. If the initial profit was 500 rupees, find the new profit. It is known the initial profit percent was 20% of cost price.

The first 3 articles were sold at a profit of 50%, the next 5 articles were sold at a loss of 25% and the final 2 articles were sold at a profit of 100%. Find the profit percentage on the whole transaction.
The profit on selling 1 article is equal to the cost price of 2 such articles. Find the profit percentage.
If the loss occurred on selling an article is 20% of the selling price, find the loss percentage.
The expense of selling an article, worth rupees 6000, is 50 rupees. If the selling expenses is 10% more than the loss, find the loss percentage.
The profit by selling an article is 40 rupees. Find the cost price if the selling price is twice the cost price.
The purchase price of an article is 20% less than the profit made. Find the profit if the selling price is 360 rupees.
The profit made by selling an article for 720 is 20%. Find the cost price.
The cost price of an article is 50% of the marked price. Find the discount if there is no profit or loss made. The selling price is 25 rupees.
The selling price of an article is 70% of the cost price. If the loss is 33 rupees, find the selling price.
The price of an article is marked 20% more than the cost price. If the discount is 20% find the profit or loss percent.
The cost price of an article is 20% of the marked price. Find the loss or profit percent if the discount allowed is 40% of the marked price.
The cost price of an article is 50 rupees. Find the selling price if the profit is 1 / 3rd of the selling price.
The selling price of an article is half the loss incurred. Find the ratio between the cost price and the selling price.
The profit on selling 10 articles is equal to the cost price of 3 articles. Find the profit percentage.
The price of a pair of slippers is decreased by 10% and the selling price is constant. If the initial profit percentage was equal to 25%, find the new profit percentage.
If the profit is increased to 500 rupees the profit percentage is increased by 10% find the initial profit.
The cost price of an article is doubled, and the selling price is made half. If the initial profit percentage was 500%, find the profit percentage now.
The cost price of an article is 80% of its selling price, find the profit percentage.
The profit on selling 10 articles is equal to selling price of 1 article. Find the profit percentage.
The selling price of an article is 1200 rupees. If the profit percentage is 20%, find the profit.
The profit on selling 15 articles is equal to the cost price of 2 articles. Find the profit percentage.
The selling price of 17 articles is equal to the cost price of 21 articles. Find the profit or loss percentage.
The cost of 12 articles is equal to the selling price of 15 articles. Find the profit or loss percentage.
The marked price of an article is 12% more than the selling price. What is the discount percentage?
The selling price of an article is 20% less than the profit. If the cost price is 200 rupees, find the selling price.
The cost price of an article is 2450 rupees. Find the profit if the selling price and the cost price are in a ratio 7 : 11.
The cost price of an article is 1.35 times the selling price. Find the loss percent.
The cost price of an article is 6.5 times the profit. Find the profit percentage.
Find the profit percentage if the selling price is 1.25 times the profit.
The profit earned by selling an article for 670 rupees is 23%. Find the cost price.
The cost price of an article is 1.56 times the selling price. Find the loss percentage.
The total of the selling price and the cost price is 1250. If the profit is 35%, find the selling price.
The cost price of an article is twice the discount. If the discount is 40% of the selling price, find the profit or loss percent.
